5.46. 
Revocation and nullity of the will of the common spouses
1. Either spouse may, before the succession has occurred, revoke the expression of his or her will in the same way as if the will had been made. In that event, the other spouse's will shall also be invalid.
2. Wills made by a spouse without revoking the joint will of the spouses shall not be valid.
3. A joint will shall not be valid if the marriage is dissolved or an action (petition) for divorce is brought or a spouse has consented to the divorce before the succession occurs.
